channel.title: String Operators :: Introduction to Python
channel.description: Resources Slides Concatenate Python includes an operator that can be used to concatenate, or combine, two strings together, one after another. We can use the plus symbol + between two strings to concatenate them together into a single string, making it much simpler to build more complex strings and outputs. A simple example is shown below: first = "Hello" second = "World" print(first + second) When executed, this code will display this output:
